meanings.definition: A slip or error in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: During his presentation, he made a lapsus and mispronounced a key word.
meanings.sent2: I noticed a small lapsus in the article where a word was misspelled.
meanings.sent3: The lapsus in her speech caused some confusion among the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her lapsus in writing the report led to some misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The lapsus in his speech was so obvious that everyone noticed.

meanings.definition: A temporary or minor mistake or fault.
meanings.sent1: Making a lapsus like that is common and nothing to worry about.
meanings.sent2: She quickly corrected the lapsus in her calculations before submitting the assignment.
meanings.sent3: His lapsus in remembering the date of the meeting made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The lapsus in the recipe caused the dish to turn out differently than expected.
meanings.sent5: Even a small lapsus in the code can cause the program to malfunction.

meanings.definition: A lapse in judgment or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His lapsus in decision-making led to some negative consequences.
meanings.sent2: She regretted the lapsus in her behavior at the party.
meanings.sent3: The lapsus in his judgment made him choose the wrong path.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the lapsus in his behavior only made things worse.
meanings.sent5: The lapsus in her judgment was a valuable lesson for the future.
